story.kicker_image_caption: A file picture of Rohan Bopanna and Florin Mergea. (AP Photo)
story.storykicker: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Romanian partner Florin Mergea lost to third seeded pair of Ivan Dodig and Marcelo Melo in the quarters-finals of the French Open.
story.storybody:
India's tennis star Rohan Bopanna and his men's doubles partner Florin Mergea were knocked out in the quarters-finals of the French Open today.

Third seeded pair of Croatia's Ivan Dodig and Brazil's Marcelo Melo defeated the Indo-Romanian sixth seeded pair 6-4, 6-4 in one hour 15 minutes to progress to the semi-finals.

The match began on a positive note for both sides as they won their respective games to make it 3-3. But Dodig-Melo broke their opponents' serve at a crucial juncture of the set to grab the advantage.

The third seed made the best use of the advantage to win all their serves thereafter to claim the first set 6-4.

In the second set, the Croatian and Brazilian dominated the proceedings as they broke Bopanna-Mergea yet again to seize the initiative and went on to win the set 6-4 and the match.
story.magazinekicker: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Romanian partner Florin Mergea lost to third seeded pair of Ivan Dodig and Marcelo Melo in the quarters-finals of the French Open.
story.shortheadline: French Open: Bopanna-Mergea knocked out of men's doubles quarters
story.storytitle: French Open: Rohan Bopanna-Florin Mergea knocked out of men's doubles quarters
story.longheadline: French Open: Rohan Bopanna-Florin Mergea knocked out of men's doubles quarters
story.strapheadline: Big blow for Rohan Bopanna ahead of Rio Olympics

briefcase_content.briefcase: Bopanna-Mergea lost to Dodig-Melo in straight sets
This year's French Open has been hit by consistent rain
India's Leander Paes has also reached men's doubles quarters
